events.title: Battle of Falkirk
events.description: Edward I of England defeated William Wallace's Scottish forces, a major battle in the First War of Scottish Independence.
events.significance: The defeat significantly weakened the Scottish resistance against English rule during the Wars of Scottish Independence.

events.title: Battle of Dornach
events.description: The Old Swiss Confederacy defeated the forces of the Swabian League, ending the Swabian War.
events.significance: The Swiss victory secured de facto independence from the Holy Roman Empire for the Swiss Confederacy.

events.title: Montagnards execute Charlotte Corday
events.description: Charlotte Corday was executed by guillotine for assassinating Jean-Paul Marat, a radical Jacobin leader, during the French Revolution.
events.significance: Her execution exemplified the extreme political violence during the Reign of Terror in revolutionary France.

events.title: King David Hotel bombing
events.description: A Zionist paramilitary group, the Irgun, bombed the King David Hotel in Jerusalem, killing 91 people in the deadliest attack during the British Mandate of Palestine.
events.significance: The attack intensified tensions leading to the end of British rule and the establishment of Israel.

events.title: Norway attacks
events.description: Anders Behring Breivik carried out a bombing in Oslo and a mass shooting at a youth camp on Ut√∏ya island, killing 77 people and injuring many others.
events.significance: The attacks shocked Norway and the world, highlighting the threat of far-right terrorism in Europe.
